trans-unit.source: The data source control used by data-bound controls to perform CRUD (create, read, update, delete) operations when model binding is in use.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelDataSource"></xref> class.
The data-bound control.
The dataControl parameter is `null`.
Occurs when model binding is in use and data methods are being called.
Gets the data-bound control that is using this control as a data source when model binding is in use.
The data-bound control.
Returns a value that indicates whether the control is tracking view state.
`true` if the control is tracking view state; otherwise, `false`.
Loads the previously saved view state.
This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce).
The saved view state.
Saves the state of the control.
Returns the control's current view state; otherwise, returns `null`, if there is no view state associated with the control.
Tracks view-state changes to the control so that they can be stored in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
This method can be overridden to mark the starting point to begin tracking and saving changes to the control as part of the view state for the object.
Updates the required properties for one-way data binding.
The name of the model type.
The name of the select method.
Updates the required properties for two-way data binding.
The name of the model type.
The name of the select method.
The name of the update method.
The name of the insert method.
The name of the delete method.
The data key name.
Gets the default (and only) view object for this data source control.
The view object.
Returns the view.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelDataSource> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSource> interface.
The name of the view.
The view.
Gets the view names.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelDataSource> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSource> interface.
The view names.
Returns a value that indicates whether the control is tracking view state.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelDataSource> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
`true` if the control is tracking view state; otherwise, `false`.
Loads the previously saved view state.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelDataSource> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
The saved view state.
Saves the state of the control.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelDataSource> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
Returns the control's current view state; otherwise, returns `null`, if there is no view state associated with the control.
Tracks view-state changes to the control so that they can be stored in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelDataSource> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
